body:
1. Raise minSdk to 19.
2. Fix a bug where drag selection remains active after raising your finger. See #34.
3. Dependency upgrades.
You can set a listener that is invoked when auto scroll starts or ends.

1. Kotlin 1.2.70 2. Switched from legacy Support Libraries to AndroidX. Stay on 2.0.0 if your app is stuck with the former. 3. Fix behavior of `setIsActive` when passing false for the first parameter. 4. Add a selection mode configuration option. `RANGE` is the default behavior, `PATH` is a new behavior option.

1. Updated dependencies, target API 28.
2. Converted the whole project to Kotlin.
3. You no longer need a custom `RecyclerView` or adapter. Everything is handled with a simple item touch listener and receiver interface.

Check out the README and sample!

Got rid the included adapter class, now you just use `DragSelectRecyclerView` with a plain `RecyclerView.Adapter` which implements an interface.

See the README and sample project for more details.

1. Updated Gradle and Gradle plugin
2. Google libs 25.0.0
3. Target SDK 25
4. `selectAll()` method
Updated target SDK, Google libs, Gradle, Gradle plugin, etc.

1. `restoreInstanceState` and `saveInstanceState` for `DragSelectRecyclerViewAdapter` now accept an optional key parameter, so you can save and restore states for multiple adapter instances in the same `Activity` or `Fragment`.
2. Added two attributes, `dsrv_autoScrollHotspot_offsetTop` and `dsrv_autoScrollHotspot_offsetBottom`, which can be used to adjust space between the top and bottom of the `RecyclerView` and the auto scroll hotspots.
Updated for the latest versions of Google's libs, including AppCompat and RecyclerView.

1. Lots of library updates.
2. Added max selected count capability.

Republishing this version to fix remote building.
1. Added a "finger listener" to `DragSelectRecyclerView` which can be used to detect when the user is actively drag-selecting (with their finger down).
2. Other improvements and fixes to behavior.

1. The API takes care of keeping track of RecyclerView item indices, make sure you don't override tags set to a view holder's `itemView`.
2. Added `isIndexSelectable(int)` to the adapter. Overriding it allows you to prevent certain items from being selected.
3. Other updates and fixes.

_Included from 0.2.0-0.2.1_:
1. Auto-scroll capabilities, holding your finger at the top or bottom during selection mode will auto-scroll like Google Photos. See the README for more info.
2. When retrieving selected indices, they are no longer force-sorted by index.
A quick update to 0.2.0, selected indices are no longer force sorted by index.

Auto-scroll capabilities, like Google Photos. It's now enabled by default.

See: https://github.com/afollestad/drag-select-recyclerview#auto-scroll

`getSelectedIndices()` will return a sorted list of indices rather than a sometimes random list.

It will be in reverse (higher to smaller) order if the user is selected items in reverse, and vice versa.

1. Some minor but important bug fixes.
2. Updated the sample to show additional features.
3. New demo GIF in the README.
